Key Match Events: India lost all its wickets at 102 and lost by 13 runs
Shubman Gill scored 31 runs and Washington Sundar scored 27 runs
Sikandar Raza and Tendai Chatara took three wickets each
Brian Bennett, Wellington Masakadza, Blessing Muzarabani and Luke Jongwe picked one wicket each
Pre-Game Insights: Chasing 116 runs at Harare against Zimbabwe, India lost all its wickets at 102 and lost by 13 runs in the first T20I series on 6 July
This will be the first time the Men in Blue have played in Zimbabwe since 2016
The Zimbabwe series has taken on new significance following the T20 World Cup victory and the subsequent retirements of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Ravindra Jadeja from T20 cricket
Zimbabwe, on the other hand, come into this series after losing their last series against Bangladesh 4-1 in May
Post-Match Reflections: Shubman Gill said, 'We bowled pretty well, we let ourselves down in the field. We were not up to standard and everyone looked a bit rusty.'

Sikandar Raza said, 'Feel really happy about the win. Need to take one game at a time. The job is not done, series is not over. World champions play like world champions so we need to be ready for the next game.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's lowest all out total in T20Is in the last eight years
A young side, India, will take on Zimbabwe in the first match of the Sports 5 T20I series at the Harare Sports Club on Saturday
Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza became the 'Player of the Match'
It's 25 degrees in Harare right now, as per AccuWeather. During the course of the game, the temperature is likely to go down to 15 degrees.
